instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3787: What is 820-3787? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.R7121: What is R7121? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7122: What is R7122? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7151: What is R7151? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7152: What is R7152? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> charger shuts down
threads.message:
Hi-
Customer was using aftermarket charger.
Was 3.42 on PPBUS. Bad magsafe i/o board, <RESISTOR>R7122</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R7121</RESISTOR> and ISL.
Replaced all said components, and now have 12.56V and a booting machine.
The problem is when both battery and charger are plugged in, the light on the charger goes dead and computer no longer recognizes it after about 45 secs.. I have to reset the charger by unplugging for 30 seconds and plugging back in, then it will turn green again.
Reverse Current Protection?
Without battery I have no problems.
Will run on charged battery by itself.
Have tried with multiple batteries.
Multiple magsafes.
Thanks, have a good one.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> charger shuts down
threads.message: Might be worth checking <RESISTOR>R7151</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R7152</RESISTOR> - current sensing for the battery. Also pins 17/18 on ISL may give you some hints

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> charger shuts down
threads.message:
[USER="1404"]jamiehorn1[/USER] 
At the time when I replaced <RESISTOR>R7121</RESISTOR>/22 I was getting 3 Ohms on <RESISTOR>R7151</RESISTOR>/52, so I figured everything was OK on the battery side. Shortly after my post,  <RESISTOR>R7121</RESISTOR>/22 went out again. This time <RESISTOR>R7151</RESISTOR>/52 went out as well. Replaced everything again including <RESISTOR>R7150</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R7120</RESISTOR> and transistors on Batt side and adapter side. Everything Is now working . Thanks for your input. Much appreciated.
